quest.name: Wrath of the Titan
journal: Minfilia is waiting to brief you and your fellow Scions on a new development.

The Maelstrom has requested that the Scions slay the primal Titan, who has been summoned by a tribe of kobolds who reside near Limsa Lominsa. Report to High Storm Commander R'ashaht Rhiki at Maelstrom Command for further information.

Upon arriving at Maelstrom Command, you are received by Admiral Merlwyb Bloefhiswyn herself, who pledges the full support of the Maelstrom in the forthcoming operation. Before risking direct confrontation with Titan, Y'shtola proposes that you learn more about your foe by speaking to former members of the Company of Heroes─the famous band of mercenaries who defeated the dread primal once before. She directs you to the Grey Fleet mills in lower La Noscea, where one such individual is said to reside.
Your search leads you to Trachtoum, the self-proclaimed “best axeman” of the Company of Heroes. Explain the situation to him and see what he has to say.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: The Maelstrom requests our assistance.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Concerning the kobolds they sent such copious notes on, I presume?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Yes, and no. It has more to do with their findings, which portend a peril far greater than any beast tribe.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: What sort of peril?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: The worst kind. A tribe of kobolds in the vicinity of Limsa Lominsa has reawakened Titan.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Our task will be to slay the primal. The Maelstrom have sworn support for the endeavor.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: They are no strangers to the havoc kobolds can wreak.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Years before the Grand Company's reformation, two primals, Leviathan and Titan, chanced to converge upon the seawall, wreaking untold devastation.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: There, by the grace of the Navigator, were the mercenaries Merlwyb hired able to fend them off.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Yet it did not take long for the beast tribes to regroup, and they summoned their primals once more.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Thankfully, their second coming was decidedly short-lived─but that is beside the point.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: So long as tormented souls will them to exist, the realm will never be rid of primals.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The Maelstrom has kept a watchful eye upon the beast tribes─and the kobolds in particular─ever since.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Which brings us to the matter at hand.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Unlike Ifrit, we know scarcely anything of Titan.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, the only force known to have bested him─the modestly named “Company of Heroes”─disbanded five years since, and mercenaries are not in the habit of keeping chronicles.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Expect the worst.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The Maelstrom's help is of course appreciated, but even if we had their whole armada at our disposal, we could still find ourselves overmatched.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: A pity the kobolds lack the gentle sensibilities of the sylphs. A peaceful resolution would be more than welcome.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The Echo will not avail you this time, I fear. If you are to survive, your steel must needs speak for you.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: No one would think you a coward were you to decline.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: So you will accept?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: We can't very well send herhim to Limsa Lominsa without Y'shtola, can we, Minfilia?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: May I ask that of you, Y'shtola?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I never thought it in question.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Ever reliable.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Very well. We will spare no effort to win victory.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: You may count on the full support of the Scions of the Seventh Dawn.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: And all not afield will aid the fight from afar.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Thancred, Yda, go to the Grand Companies. Tell them of our plight and solicit their support.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Urianger, send word to the Students of Baldesion─and Alphinaud, if you would.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Papalymo, compile all the information we have on Titan, little though it may be.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: You'll be apprised of the tactical situation when you reach the Sailors Ward.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Provision yourself for the journey. May you walk in the light of the Crystal.

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: Good to see you, [GC Rank][GC Rank][GC Rank] Surname.

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: The Scions sent word that you were on your way.

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: Hail, adventurer, and welcome to Maelstrom Command. If you wish to know more about enlisting, speak with the personnel officer.

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: Unless...you are the guest we were told to expect? Ah...ha. Ahem. Forgive me, madamsir.

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: To business, then. It is as we told the Antecedent. The kobolds have once again summoned Titan.

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: A little over a moon ago, we began to observe the beastmen moving south in increasing numbers from O'Ghomoro.

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: Our scouts subsequently confirmed the object of their aggression─

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Crystals. Fodder for their fell primal.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text:
Thank you, High Commander. You may leave the rest to me.
[GC Rank]Your deeds bring glory to the Maelstrom, SurnameWord has spread of your accomplishments, Forename. Right proud am I to call you one of our ownOn behalf of Limsa Lominsa, I thank you for heeding our call.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Forgive the lack of forewarning, High Commander. The Admiral wished to address Forename personally.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: We are no strangers to conflict. Long have the Sahagin and the kobolds plagued our people─nor is this the first time we have had to address a primal threat.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: In the past, when Titan rose to threaten the peace, it was to the Company of Heroes we turned.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: But they are long disbanded, and we must look to other brave souls blessed with the strength to face this foe.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: So it is that we turn now to the Scions of the Seventh Dawn, confident in the belief that you are Limsa's best hope.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I hope you are right. Yet the situation is far from simple. The kobolds are not prone to unprovoked aggression. Did not the thalassocracy make a pact with the beastmen that each would keep to their own lands, and that no blood would be shed?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...And was it not the Lominsans who violated this agreement, dissatisfied with their lot? Shall we then condemn the beastmen for defending their homes?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Even a pirate must one day reap what she has sown.

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: I would advise you to choose your words with greater care, Lady Y'shtola!

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Stand down, High Commander. She has the right of it.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text:
And the wrong is mine. Freely do I claim it. Yet it makes little difference. Remorse will not shield us from Titan's wrath.
...Or would you have us fall upon our swords?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: My apologies, Admiral. The safety and security of Limsa Lominsa's citizenry are, of course, of paramount concern.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Already, we have observed disruptions in the flow of aether further inland. The effects will be felt here in the city ere long.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I ask much of you, I know, but the need is great. [GC Rank]I trust I can count on you, Can I count on your help, Forename?

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: You have my thanks, along with the full support of the Maelstrom. I await good tidings.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: That the kobolds should summon Titan demonstrates they are no longer amenable to negotiation.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: This being the case, we must needs prepare for conflict. Before we meet Titan in the field, however, it would be wise to learn all we can of our foe. And I can think of no better source of information than the mercenaries who defeated him once before.

dialogue.name: RASHAHT
dialogue.text: The Company of Heroes may be no more, but several of its former members still live. It is said that one of them is employed at the Grey Fleet mills in lower La Noscea.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Quite why a mercenary should choose to become a miller, I do not know. When you find him, mayhap you could ask him for me. I, meanwhile, shall seek his fellows.

dialogue.name: TRACHTOUM
dialogue.text:
Lay down yer burdens, son,♪
Come drain a pint with me,♪
We'll have a grand ol' time,♪
Find ye a lass or three...♪

dialogue.name: TRACHTOUM
dialogue.text:
Ye gonna say somethin', 'venturer, or just keep starin'?
Eh? Ye want to know about the Company of Heroes?

dialogue.name: TRACHTOUM
dialogue.text: Ahhh hells... Price of bleedin' fame... Can't a miller mill in peace no more!?

dialogue.name: TRACHTOUM
dialogue.text: Still, seein' as ye've come all this way, I s'pose it wouldn't hurt to oblige ye. Consider yerself lucky, lassmate─ol' Trachtoum was the Company's best axeman. Now, what was it ye wanted to know?
